entry.def: A shop is a building or part of a building where things are sold.
When you shop, you go to shops and buy things.

example.ex: He always shopped at the Co-op.
example.tran: 他一直在合作社买东西。

example.ex: ...some advice that's worth bearing in mind when shopping for a new carpet.
example.tran: 买新地毯时值得参考的一些建议

entry.def: You can refer to a place where a particular service is offered as a particular type of shop .

example.ex: ...the barber shop where Rodney sometimes had his hair cut.
example.tran: 罗德尼有时去理发的那家理发店

entry.def: You can refer to a place where things are made or done as a particular kind of shop .
If you shop someone, you report them to the police for doing something illegal.

example.ex: His father was so disgusted to discover his son was dealing drugs he shopped him to police...
example.tran: 他父亲发现儿子在贩毒时深感憎恶，就向警察告发了他。

example.ex: Fraudsters are often shopped by honest friends and neighbours.
example.tran: 诈骗犯经常会被正直守法的朋友和邻居告发。

entry.def: If something is happening all over the shop, it is happening in many different places or throughout a wide area.

example.ex: This gave them the freedom to make trouble all over the shop without fear of retribution.
example.tran: 这使他们可以肆意到处惹是生非，而不用担心受到惩罚。

entry.def: If you set up shop, you start a business.

example.ex: He set up shop as an independent PR consultant...
example.tran: 他自己开公司，做起了独立公共关系顾问。

example.ex: He has just set up shop in Cherbourg.
example.tran: 他刚刚在瑟堡开业不久。

entry.tran: (商店、办事处、公司)休息，下班，打烊，停业，歇业
entry.def: When a shop, office, or firm shuts up shop, it stops doing business and closes, either at the end of the day or permanently.

example.ex: If they had been faced with the bill they'd have shut up shop and fled the country.
example.tran: 他们要是看到这账单，早就关门歇业逃到国外去了。

entry.tran: 谈论本行工作;三句话不离本行
entry.def: If you say that people are talking shop, you mean that they are talking about their work, and this is boring for other people who do not do the same work.

example.ex: If you hang around with colleagues all the time you just end up talking shop.
example.tran: 如果整天和同事泡在一起的话，你最终就会变得开口闭口都是工作。

means.word_mean: 1. someone who visits stores in search of articles to buy
2. a commercial agent who shops at the competitor's store in order to compare their prices and merchandise with those of the store that employs her

Sentence.sentence: To make shoppers see as many items as possible.
Shoppers refrained from buying cars, appliances, and other big-ticket items.

means.word_mean: (商店的)顾客, 买东西的人

sentences.cn: 每个购物者都会需要的东西

sentences.en: We tried to make our way through the crowds of shoppers.
sentences.cn: 我们设法从购物的人潮中挤过去。
